definition: to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: Eels are relentless in their effort to return to their oceanic womb.
sentences.chinese: 鳗鱼重返大海子宫的努力百折不挠。

sentences.english: But the dog egg tenacity and every time I come persistence give to the elderly gifts.
sentences.chinese: 但是狗蛋百折不挠，每次来坚持给给老人送礼。

sentences.english: To the love persistent TongXiaoChun saved the belongs to own love.
sentences.chinese: 对爱情百折不挠的童小春挽回了属于自己的爱情。

sentences.english: Perseverance in the face of extreme hardship.
sentences.chinese: 面对极端困苦而百折不挠。

sentences.english: "He's an old fish, and he's absolutely relentless," Joe said.
sentences.chinese: 他是一种古老的鱼，他绝对百折不挠。

definition: see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
